column5: Hey all.  So I was at BPS to burn off $150 work of G.Cards on the weekend and now i think I need to find me a good worm binder type case for most of my plastics.  Any idea what's good out there (last's long) and at a decent price?  I just started looking at what I have in my 'stock' and OH MAN, I need something to keep it tidy...  Thanks all!  Geoff
Thats a binder not a bender ..... right Geoff .........lol.

I had two from Storm. They were cheap, plastics bled thru them, so I would never go with them again. The best one I have is the BPS brand that I use for spinnerbaits. The plastic trailers do not bleed thru, heavier all around.
You really know how to "BAIT"  someone Skip !!!

I'm not sure if they are still around, but I bought a bunch of blue double sided zippered BPS worm bags. Never has a problem with them and they hold 40 replaceable bags. They come in different sizes. If you still can find them, I highly recommend these.
I also have the storm ones..No issues here if you leave them in the orignal packages..Going on year 3 now...

Tks  Tks  Too bad I didn't think to look for them when I was there last weekend...  I know the Storm ones were sold all over the place like Princess Auto for next to nothing $ wise and from what I can tell, not too interested in those ones.  Any other ideas/thoughts?  I have grubs and others I need a home for that is easy to cart around, cheers.  PS, Skip and Paul, I don't do that anymore mid week, well, sort of...  I need to be on a train to damn early for that...
I dumped the binders a while ago and started using the plano cases, I find these way more convenient to use in the boat.

Same here but for the short trips in the tinny or a day out in a boat with a buddy it can come in handy, hence the reason I'm looking.  I have over a few dozen of the mid to large plano hard trays I can stuff in a bag but I would rather be light and use less space.
